IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Case Type: Fatal Overdose 
Location: 2661 Meadowbrook Rd Federalsburg, Caroline County, Maryland, 21632
Date and Time: 06/07/2023 0751 hours 
Attachments: Death Investigation form, Property Held, Chain of Custody 
Body Worn Camera Footage: https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=fe9ee4abb2aa4f8a93f09d5bd044a56f&partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1
Narrative:

    On 06/07/2023 at 0751 hours, I TFC Embert, was dispatched to 2661 Meadowbrook Rd, Federalsburg, MD for an unattended death. Caroline County EMS was obscene and had confirmed that the patient was deceased. 

    Upon arriving on scene, I made contact with EMS personnel and was informed that it appeared that the subject, Larry Mathews, had overdosed on an illegal substance. EMS stated that they had found Larry in rigor mortis, and that he had dependent lividity. They also warned that there was drug paraphernalia in the shed where he was staying and that he had a needle still in his hand. EMS personnel showed me where Larry was located. 

    Larry had been staying in a shed behind his parents house at the above listed address. The shed was heated and cooled, had power, and running water. The interior was not in disarray and was relatively well-kept. I found Larry in the corner immediately left of the door. Larry was face down, and crumpled with his knees underneath himself. His hands were curled in, and I could observe a hypodermic syringe in the patients left hand. I also observed Larry to be in rigor mortis and have dependent lividity. Drug task force, the criminal investigations' division, and the medical examiner's office was called to respond to the scene. 

    I interviewed Teddy Matthews, who is Larry's father, and who discovered Larry. Teddy stated that he had not seen Larry the previous day and had gone to check on him. When Teddy entered the shed he discovered Larry and immediately called 911. Teddy stated that it was not uncommon to not see Larry for a day at a time but that he wanted to go check on him to make sure he was okay. 

    Upon a brief search of the shed in which Larry was living in, multiple items of drug paraphernalia was found. This included, one metal spoon with drug residue, six cut straws, two hypodermic syringes, and ten white and blue empty wax folds. All property was processed in accordance to Maryland State Police policy and procedure. 

Frampton Funeral Home responded to the scene and transported Larry's body to the medical examiners' office in Baltimore. 

All events did occur in Caroline County Maryland. 

I request this case be closed.

On June 7, 2023 at approximately 0752 hours, troopers assigned to the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack were dispatched to 2661 Meadowbrook Road, Federalsburg, Caroline County, Maryland 21632 for the report of a suspected fatal overdose. Due to the nature of the incident, investigators assigned to the Criminal Enforcement Division - Eastern Region (CEDER) responded to the scene. 

        Upon arrival, investigators made contact with Teddy and Diana Matthews (hereinafter "Teddy" or "Diana") who were identified as the parents of the decedent, Larry Scott Matthews (hereinafter "Larry" [W/M, DOB: 07/07/1972]). The following information was obtained from Teddy and Diana: 

        Larry has been residing in a makeshift dwelling located in the back yard of the property for approximately 6 or 7 years. Larry had no known history of mental illness; however, he had a well-known and longstanding battle with addiction to prescription painkillers and heroin which began when he was 15-years-old after a hip injury. No other medical history was known by Teddy or Diana. Teddy and Diana advised that Larry presented no indicators that he was abusing controlled dangerous substances recently until the current day. 

        Larry was last seen alive on June 5, 2023 at approximately 1430 hours by Diana at their residence. During that time, Larry advised Diana that he was planning to go to Grasonville that day; however, both Diana and Teddy were unsure if he actually left the residence that day. Between June 5, 2023 at approximately 1430 hours and June 7, 2023 prior to calling 911, Diana reported that Larry did not respond to multiple text messages which prompted them to check on him. Upon entering Larry's dwelling, they observed that he was unconscious, unresponsive, and positioned in an unusual manner in the corner of the room. 911 was called at this time. Caroline County Emergency Medical Services responded to the scene and Larry was pronounced dead at 0800 hours.

        Investigators observed Larry's body in the corner of a room positioned on his knees with his torso leaning forward and downward. Observed in in his left hand was a syringe and needle. The body was cold to the touch. Rigor mortis was present and lividity was noted in the fact and arms. A survey of the room revealed multiple items indicative of illicit drug use, to include: a spoon with suspected CDS residue, multiple straws, syringe caps, and wax-folds stamped, "OREO" which contained suspected CDS / residue. Cellular devices were located in the room which were examined by members of the Caroline County Drug Task Force. 

        A Forensic Investigator (FI) with the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner's Office (OCME) responded tot he scene and the determination was made that the body would be transported to the OCME's Office for an autopsy. Framtom's Funeral Home responded to the scene and removed the body.

        Based on the above information, it is believed that the decedent died in an accidental manner subsequent to an overdose of a controlled dangerous substance. This case will remain open pending the autopsy report conducted by the OCME. 

Case open, investigation continuing.

The Maryland Office of the Chief Medical Examiner's Office provided the autopsy report for Larry Scott Matthews which provided the following opinion: 

Cause of Death: Fentanyl and Despropionyl Fentanyl Intoxication
Manner of Death: Could not be determined. 

Case closed.
